detaileddescription.para: D++ is a lightweight and simple library for Discord written in modern C++. It is designed to cover as much of the API specification as possible and take very little memory to do so, even when caching large amounts of the data to cut down on HTTP requests.
It is created by the developer of TriviaBot and contributed to by a dedicated team of developers.

para.emphasis: This project is now in stable development and accepting PRs and feature requests Don't be a stranger! If you want to contribute, just get in touch via github or our Discord server!

listitem.para: Efficient caching system for guilds, channels, guild members, roles, users
Sharding (Many shards, one process: specify the number of shards, or let the library decide)
The entire Discord API is available for use in the library
Ready-made compiled packages for Windows, Raspberry Pi (ARM64/ARM7) and Debian x86/x64

detaileddescription.para: The library runs great on Linux. Windows is also supported and we offer ready made compiled DLL and LIB files for easy integration into any windows visual studio 2019 project. Mac OS X and FreeBSD is also functional and stable, as is running your bot on a Raspberry Pi - we offer a prebuilt .deb for ARM64, ARM6 and ARM7 to save on having to wait for it to compile.
The library may work fine in other operating systems too, if you run a D++ bot on something not listed here please let us know!
